Nikuba simply breaks down hydrogen and oxygen in water (H₂O) using electrical energy, this process is called electrolysis. Well, then the electrolyzed hydrogen is used as fuel. simple as that

Nikuba works more or less like this

Water > is electrolyzed > becomes hydrogen > is burned > becomes energy of motion

The electrolysis process in Nikuba takes electrical energy from the battery. Many experts suspect that the battery in the motorbike will run out because the electrolysis process is very inefficient and energy-intensive.

You can charge the battery from the motorbike engine right?

Remember the laws of thermodynamics in physics class? Ever heard of the law of the conservation of energy?

"Energy cannot be created or destroyed. Energy can only be changed into other forms of energy" << this is an important point, right?

From the law of the conservation of energy, let's try to apply it to Nikuba, and we assume that the electrolysis process is 100% efficient (which is actually impossible).

Battery = 100 electrical energy > electrolysis process by nikuba > 100 electrical energy changes to 100 hydrogen energy > burned by engine > 70 heat energy 30 energy of motion > 30 energy of motion is broken down again 15 energy of motion for wheels 15 energy of motion to drive alternator > 15 energy motion is converted into 15 electrical energy for the battery.

The battery, which originally had 100 electrical energy at the end of the cycle, only received 15 electrical energy supply from the alternator. This is where many are skeptical that a motorcycle battery should be running short because it keeps sucking up electricity.

Text:
Kebanyakan ngehayal nih orang. Ini sebenarnya bicara hal dasar dalam fisika yaitu masalah konversi energi.

Air itu H2O jika ingin dipecah menjadi H2 (hidrogen)  +  O2 (oksigen), atau nama lainnya adalah elektrolisis, itu membutuhkan energi.

Dalam teknologi Nikuba, Air atau H2O dipecah menggunakan ENERGI LISTRIK. Kemudian dihasilkanlah H2 atau Hidrogen yang kemudian dijadikan bahan bakar untuk menghasilkan ENERGI untuk menggerakan Sepeda Motor. Dari segi Fisika (Termodinamika dan konversi energi) hal ini sangatlah tidak efisien. 

Daripada menggunakan energi listrik untuk memecah senyawa air menjadi hidrogen, kemudian hidrogen dibakar jadi energi penggerak motor yang jelas akan sangat tidak efisien. Lebih baik langsung saja menggunakan energi Listrik utntuk menggerakan motor (ini yang banyak dikembangkan sekarang yaitu motor listrik). 

Ya jelas teknologi macam Nikuba ini ga akan berkembang, sudah jelas jelas tidak efisien secara Hukum Termodinamika dan konversi energi. 

Nah dari sini kita lihat bahwa masyarakat Indonesia tidak paham, dibuatlah narasi Seolah Air dapat menjadi bahan bakar tanpa mebutuhkan energi untuk merubah air menjadi hidrogen. TextEng:
Most people are delusional. This is actually talking about basic things in physics, namely the problem of energy conversion.

Water is H2O if you want it to be broken down into H2 (hydrogen) + O2 (oxygen), or another name is electrolysis, it requires energy.

In Nikuba technology, Water or H2O is broken down using ELECTRICITY. Then H2 or Hydrogen is produced which is then used as fuel to produce ENERGY to drive the Motorcycle. In terms of Physics (Thermodynamics and energy conversion) this is very inefficient.

Instead of using electrical energy to break down the water compound into hydrogen, then the hydrogen is burned so the driving energy of the motor will obviously be very inefficient. It's better to just use electrical energy to drive the motor (this is what is being developed now, namely electric motors).

Yes, it's clear that technology like Nikuba won't develop, it's clearly inefficient from the Law of Thermodynamics and energy conversion.
